place.name: WOLFHAMPCOTE
place.gazetteerText: WOLFHAMCOTE, a parish, with three hamlets, in Rugby district, Warwick; 3½ miles NW of Daventry, and 5 SW of Crick r. station. Post town, Rugby. Acres, 3,470. Real property, £7,698. Pop., 444. Houses, 95. The property is subdivided. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Worcester. Value, £90. Patron, Lady Hood. The church is good; and there are a Wesleyan chapel and a national school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
